description: Native valve and prosthetic valve endocarditis
critical_note: ENDOCARDITIS IS A LIFE-THREATENING INFECTION - Prolonged bactericidal therapy required

regimens.reasoning: Empiric coverage for S. aureus (including MRSA), Streptococcus, and HACEK organisms
regimens.note: Obtain 3 sets of blood cultures before starting antibiotics

regimens.reasoning: Ceftriaxone safe for mild PCN allergy
Aztreonam for gram-negative coverage with severe PCN allergy
No cross-reactivity

categories.category: Native Valve Endocarditis - Subacute (Viridans Strep suspected)

regimens.reasoning: Ceftriaxone for viridans streptococci and nutritionally variant streptococci
Ceftriaxone safe for mild allergy
Vancomycin for streptococcal endocarditis with severe PCN allergy
Vancomycin alternative for cephalosporin allergy
Broad empiric coverage for coagulase-negative staph, S. aureus, and gram-negatives
regimens.note: Consult cardiothoracic surgery - may need valve replacement

regimens.reasoning: Cefepime safe for mild allergy
Aztreonam for gram-negative coverage
Daptomycin for MRSA with vancomycin allergy (8-10 mg/kg for endocarditis)
regimens.note: Higher dose daptomycin required for endocarditis

regimens.reasoning: Avoid gentamicin if aminoglycoside allergy/ototoxicity
MRSA coverage for IVDU-associated endocarditis (usually right-sided)
regimens.note: Consider adding ceftriaxone if Pseudomonas risk

regimens.reasoning: Vancomycin monotherapy adequate for MRSA
Vancomycin monotherapy
Daptomycin for MRSA endocarditis (8-10 mg/kg)
Synergistic combination for enterococcal endocarditis
Ampicillin may be tolerated with mild rash-only allergy
regimens.note: Use with caution - desensitization may be needed

regimens.reasoning: Vancomycin + gentamicin for severe PCN allergy
Daptomycin + ceftriaxone for enterococcal endocarditis with vancomycin allergy
regimens.note: Consult ID - VRE endocarditis is complex

special_considerations.blood_cultures: Obtain 3 sets of blood cultures from different sites before starting antibiotics
special_considerations.echocardiography: TEE (transesophageal echo) preferred over TTE for diagnosis
special_considerations.surgery: Indications: heart failure, persistent bacteremia, large vegetations (>10mm), abscess formation
special_considerations.monitoring: Weekly blood cultures until clearance, monitor for embolic complications
special_considerations.duration: Minimum 4-6 weeks of IV antibiotics. Prosthetic valve requires 6+ weeks.

pregnancy_considerations.notes: Aminoglycosides should be avoided if possible due to ototoxicity/nephrotoxicity risk. Use beta-lactams and vancomycin.
